pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Buildtime environment variables
SOMEBAR_TERMCMD - Sets the terminal command to run when the status area is clicked.
Example
SOMEBAR_TERMCMD="foot" SOMEBAR_TERMCMD="st"
SOMEBAR_FONT - Sets the typographical style for all parts.
Example
SOMEBAR_FONT="Sans 12" SOMEBAR_FONT="Monospace 9"
SOMEBAR_PADDINGX - Sets the horizontal spacing around internal border.
Example
SOMEBAR_PADDINGX="10"
SOMEBAR_PADDINGY - Sets the vertical spacing around internal border.
Example
SOMEBAR_PADDINGY="3"
SOMEBAR_INACTIVECOLOR_FG - Sets the inactive tag color text in hex RGB.
Example
SOMEBAR_INACTIVECOLOR_FG="0xbb, 0xbb, 0xbb"
SOMEBAR_INACTIVECOLOR_BG - Sets the inactive tag color background in hex RGB.
Example
SOMEBAR_INACTIVECOLOR_BG="0x22, 0x22, 0x22"
SOMEBAR_ACTIVECOLOR_FG - Sets the active tag color text in hex RGB.
Example
SOMEBAR_ACTIVECOLOR_FG="0xee, 0xee, 0xee"
SOMEBAR_ACTIVECOLOR_BG - Sets the active tag color background in hex RGB.
Example
SOMEBAR_ACTIVECOLOR_BG="0x00, 0x55, 0x77"

use.flag: Sets the color of status component to inactive.
Rewinds back to the commit that works with all the patches.

Allow to use IPC patch to click switch workspaces on tabs.
If using dwl, the dwl[somebar] USE flag must be enabled.
Allow colours to be used to highlight parts of status bar messages.
